Terms of Use of Semantic Finlex

Semantic Finlex has been published in the form of open data divided into four graphs (Figure 1).

Figure 1. The Terms of Use of the different parts of Semantic Finlex.

The collection of original texts of acts and decrees and the decisions of the Supreme Court and the Supreme Administrative Court are openly available under a CC BY 4.0 licence. According to this licence, anyone is free to share and adapt the material and use it for any purpose, even commercially, as long as the source is appropriately indicated. For example, the source can be indicated as follows: "Semantic Finlex data service developed by the Ministry of Justice, Aalto University and Edita Publishing Ltd at http://data.finlex.fi".

Consolidated legislation is available under the CC BY-NC 4.0 licence, which is otherwise identical with CC BY 4.0 specified above but does not include the right to use the data for commercial purposes. Any such use must be separately agreed with Edita Publishing Ltd, which is the editor of Consolidated legislation published in Finlex (see the Terms of Use of Finlex, available in Finnish only).

The vocabularies published in the service are subject to the CC BY 4.0 licence.

Semantic Finlex is a public, free-of-charge service prototype based on open linked data, which includes materials produced by the Ministry of Justice. The service content is produced and maintained by Aalto University's Semantic Computing Research Group (SeCo) and Edita Publishing Ltd. The Ministry of Justice, Aalto University and Edita are not liable for any errors in the information content, or for any direct or indirect loss or damage suffered by the user due to such errors, interruptions in the use of the data network or any other disturbances.
